titles.title: To require that the headquarters for the Bureau of Land Management be located in the National Capital Region, and for other purposes.
To require that the headquarters for the Bureau of Land Management be located in the National Capital Region, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary: This bill requires that the headquarters for the Bureau of Land Management be located in the National Capital Region (a region that encompasses Washington, DC, certain counties in Maryland, and certain cities and counties in Virginia). Furthermore, all employee positions that are presently stationed in such region must remain stationed there.
